title: (x) Esquire - Mercury, Apex Sans, Stag (proprietary) {Justin Kay, Village}
content:
What fonts are they using at Esquire these days? I don’t have a recent issue handy and a friend of my wants to know. TIA.

(I tried a search, but the most recent item I found here about Esquire’s fonts was from four years ago.)

 [‹ (x) Fitnessphere logo - Corvinus/Skyline/Quirinus {Tiff, Stephen}](http://web.archive.org/web/20080905133902/http:/www.typophile.com/node/27970 "Go to previous forum topic") [(x) 96 Hours (SF Chronicle) squarish slab serif - Dispatch Cond {Yves} ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080905133902/http:/www.typophile.com/node/27941 "Go to next forum topic")
author: Mark Simonson

comments.content:
i know christain schwartz/orangeitalic drew a font for them. its a beauty:

[http://www.orangeitalic.com/stag.shtml](http://web.archive.org/web/20080905133902/http:/www.orangeitalic.com/stag.shtml "http://www.orangeitalic.com/stag.shtml")

i can’t remember off the top of my head what else they use... i know british esquire is 100% gotham.

The serif typeface is Mercury by/from Hoefler & Frere-Jones.  
The sans typeface is Apex Sans by Chester & Rick Valicenti from Thirstype.  
The slab typeface is (indeed) Stag by Christian Schwartz of Orange Italic.
While Typophile was down the last day or so I figured it out on my own, but thanks all the same for confirming my id’s.
